title: Relationship Between India, US Is Multiplicative: US Envoy To India
content: The relationship between India and the US is not just "addictive", it is "multiplicative", US envoy to India Eric Garcetti has said.
summary: The relationship between India and the US is not just "addictive", it is "multiplicative", US envoy to India Eric Garcetti has said.

title: Julian Assange: Timeline Of WikiLeaks Founder's Legal Battles
content: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange has reached a deal to plead guilty to one count of violating the U.S. espionage law, prosecutors said in court papers on Monday.
summary: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange has reached a deal to plead guilty to one count of violating the U.S. espionage law, prosecutors said in court papers on Monday.

title: India-US Ties Achieve "Escape Velocity", Says Top US Official
content: A top US official said on Monday that progress in the bilateral relationship with India has finally achieved "escape velocity", using a term from space exploration to describe the velocity required by a body to soar without the pull of gravity.
summary: A top US official said on Monday that progress in the bilateral relationship with India has finally achieved "escape velocity", using a term from space exploration to describe the velocity required by a body to soar without the pull of gravity.

title: Netanyahu Says Israel "Committed" To Gaza Ceasefire Proposal
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has announced that Israel is "committed" to the deal proposal outlined by US President Joe Biden for a ceasefire in Gaza in return for the release of hostages.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has announced that Israel is "committed" to the deal proposal outlined by US President Joe Biden for a ceasefire in Gaza in return for the release of hostages.

title: Julian Assange Freed From UK Prison After He Strikes Plea Deal With US
content: Wikileaks founder Julian Assange has agreed to plead guilty in US court to revealing military secrets in exchange for his freedom, ending his years-long legal drama, according to court documents released Monday night.
summary: Wikileaks founder Julian Assange has agreed to plead guilty in US court to revealing military secrets in exchange for his freedom, ending his years-long legal drama, according to court documents released Monday night.

title: China's Lunar Probe Carrying Samples Set To Return To Earth Today
content: A Chinese probe carrying samples from the far side of the Moon is expected to return to Earth on Tuesday, capping a technically complex 53-day mission heralded as a world first.
summary: A Chinese probe carrying samples from the far side of the Moon is expected to return to Earth on Tuesday, capping a technically complex 53-day mission heralded as a world first.

title: US Urges Israel's Defence Minister To Avoid Lebanon Escalation
content: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken called on Israel during a Monday meeting with its defense minister to avoid further escalation in Lebanon as they discussed efforts to reach a deal to free hostages in Gaza.
summary: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken called on Israel during a Monday meeting with its defense minister to avoid further escalation in Lebanon as they discussed efforts to reach a deal to free hostages in Gaza.

title: As Elections Loom In France, Macron Warns Of 'Civil War'
content: French President Emmanuel Macron told a podcast episode shown on Monday that both the far right National Rally (RN) party and the left-wing New Popular Front coalition - front runners in parliamentary election- risked bringing "civil war" to France.
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron told a podcast episode shown on Monday that both the far right National Rally (RN) party and the left-wing New Popular Front coalition - front runners in parliamentary election- risked bringing "civil war" to France.

title: Amid War With Russia, Zelensky Dismisses Senior Ukrainian Army Commander
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky replaced a high-ranking army official leading troops in the country's embattled east on Monday after he was accused of incompetence and abuse of power during the Russian invasion.
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky replaced a high-ranking army official leading troops in the country's embattled east on Monday after he was accused of incompetence and abuse of power during the Russian invasion.

title: Apple Becomes 1st Company Charged With Violating EU's DMA Rules
content: EU regulators on Monday opened a new investigation into Apple's support for alternative iOS marketplaces in Europe under the Digital Markets Act (DMA), adding that the App Store's "steering" policies violate the DMA meant to encourage competition.
summary: EU regulators on Monday opened a new investigation into Apple's support for alternative iOS marketplaces in Europe under the Digital Markets Act (DMA), adding that the App Store's "steering" policies violate the DMA meant to encourage competition.

title: How Damaged Blood Vessels Cause Dementia, Study Provides Genetic Evidence
content: A new study has provided genetic evidence linking a common condition of the blood vessels in brain to dementia and Alzheimer's disease.
summary: A new study has provided genetic evidence linking a common condition of the blood vessels in brain to dementia and Alzheimer's disease.

title: Homeless Man Finds $2,100 At Amsterdam Train Station, Returns Money To Cops
content: A homeless man found a wallet containing around 2,000 euros ($2,100) on an empty train at Amsterdam station and handed it to the police, receiving a gift voucher for his honesty.
summary: A homeless man found a wallet containing around 2,000 euros ($2,100) on an empty train at Amsterdam station and handed it to the police, receiving a gift voucher for his honesty.

title: Bangladesh's Deadliest Executioner, TikTok Star Dies After Prison Release
content: Bangladesh's deadliest executioner died Monday a year after he was released from prison where he hanged some of the country's notorious serial killers, opposition politicians convicted of war crimes and coup plotters, police said.
summary: Bangladesh's deadliest executioner died Monday a year after he was released from prison where he hanged some of the country's notorious serial killers, opposition politicians convicted of war crimes and coup plotters, police said.

title: UN Agency Sued By Israelis Over Aiding, Abetting October 7 Hamas Attack
content: The United Nations Palestinian refugee agency was sued on Monday by dozens of Israelis who accused it of aiding and abetting the Oct. 7 Hamas attack on Israel.
summary: The United Nations Palestinian refugee agency was sued on Monday by dozens of Israelis who accused it of aiding and abetting the Oct. 7 Hamas attack on Israel.

title: Ukrainian President Zelensky Replaces Commander Of Joint Forces
content: President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Monday he had appointed Brigadier-General Andriy Hnatov as commander of the Joint Forces of Ukraine's armed forces, replacing Lieutenant-General Yuri Sodol.
summary: President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Monday he had appointed Brigadier-General Andriy Hnatov as commander of the Joint Forces of Ukraine's armed forces, replacing Lieutenant-General Yuri Sodol.

title: UK Baby-Killer Lucy Letby Denies Attempted Murder, Harm At Retrial
content: Convicted UK baby killer Lucy Letby said on Monday she has never intended or tried to harm any baby in her care, when giving evidence at a retrial for attempted murder.
summary: Convicted UK baby killer Lucy Letby said on Monday she has never intended or tried to harm any baby in her care, when giving evidence at a retrial for attempted murder.

title: Senior Hamas Weapons Expert Killed During Gaza Offensive, Says Israel
content: Rajasthan Chief Minister Bhajan Lal Sharma on Monday paid a visit to former state Chief Minister and senior Congress leader Ashok Gehlot to enquire about his well-being.
summary: Rajasthan Chief Minister Bhajan Lal Sharma on Monday paid a visit to former state Chief Minister and senior Congress leader Ashok Gehlot to enquire about his well-being.

title: New Ketamine Pill Treats Depression Without Psychedelic Effects: Study
content: A new pill that slowly releases ketamine could treat people with severe depression without giving them the psychedelic side effects of the often-misused drug, early trial results suggested on Monday.
summary: A new pill that slowly releases ketamine could treat people with severe depression without giving them the psychedelic side effects of the often-misused drug, early trial results suggested on Monday.

title: UK Boy Receives World's First Epilepsy Device Implanted In Skull
content: The device, emitting a continuous pulse of current, aims to block or disrupt these abnormal signals.
summary: The device, emitting a continuous pulse of current, aims to block or disrupt these abnormal signals.

title: Hacker Demands $8 Million After Cyber Attack On Indonesia's Data Centre
content: A cyberattack on Indonesia's national data centre compromised hundreds of government offices and caused long delays at the capital's main airport, with the hacker demanding an $8 million ransom, officials said Monday.
summary: A cyberattack on Indonesia's national data centre compromised hundreds of government offices and caused long delays at the capital's main airport, with the hacker demanding an $8 million ransom, officials said Monday.
